title: Sketching a Model on Fisheries Enforcement and Compliance -- A Survey. (arXiv:2306.16960v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: Monitoring and enforcement considerations have been largely forgotten in the study of fishery management. This paper discusses this issue through a model formalization to show the impacts of costly, imperfect enforcement of law on the behavior of fishing firms and fisheries management. Theoretical analysis merges a standard bio-economic model of fisheries (Gordon-Schaefer) with Becker theory of Crime and Punishment.

translated_title: 绘制一个针对渔业执法和合规性的模型-一项调查
translated_abstract: 监测和执法的考虑在渔业管理研究中被大部分人忽略。本文通过模型形式化来讨论这个问题，以展示法律成本高昂、执法不完善对渔业公司和渔业管理行为的影响。理论分析将渔业的标准生态经济模型（戈登-舍弗）与贝克尔的犯罪与惩罚理论相结合。
tldr: 本文通过将渔业的标准生态经济模型与犯罪与惩罚理论结合，形式化地讨论了监测和执法在渔业管理中的重要性，并展示了法律成本高昂、执法不完善对渔业公司和管理行为的影响。
en_tdlr: This paper formalizes the importance of monitoring and enforcement in fisheries management by combining the standard bio-economic model of fisheries with Becker's theory of Crime and Punishment, showing the impacts of costly, imperfect enforcement on fishing firms and management behavior.
